intro: Neomitranthes stictophylla, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and small, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. Its flowers are typically small and yellowish, appearing in clusters during the cooler months. Neomitranthes stictophylla is well adapted to arid and rocky environments, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species.
